[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Serialization: Cross-version compatibility] Can serialization format changes across Aptos versions cause InputSecret values to deserialize incorrectly, breaking DKG protocol compatibility? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Serialization: Memory layout] Can attackers exploit knowledge of InputSecret's memory layout (through #[repr(transparent)] on containing types) to craft exploits targeting specific memory offsets? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Struct: InputSecret] [Send/Sync safety] Is InputSecret properly Send + Sync, or can race conditions occur when secrets are shared across threads during parallel DKG operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Function: add_assign()] [Data race] Can concurrent calls to add_assign() on the same InputSecret cause data races, corrupting the secret value during aggregation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Function: generate()] [RNG thread safety] If the same RNG is used across multiple threads calling generate(), can thread interleaving cause RNG state corruption or non-uniform sampling? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Struct: InputSecret] [Interior mutability] If InputSecret is wrapped in Arc or RefCell, can interior mutability patterns allow multiple mutable references, violating uniqueness assumptions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Struct: InputSecret] [Generic parameter F] Can InputSecret be instantiated with F that doesn't satisfy cryptographic properties (like weak field characteristics), undermining security? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Struct: InputSecret] [Trait bound weakness] Are the trait bounds on F (ark_ff::Field, ark_ff::PrimeField) sufficient to guarantee all security properties, or can edge-case field types break assumptions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Trait: Uniform] [PrimeField requirement] Why does Uniform only require F: ark_ff::PrimeField while InputSecret accepts F: ark_ff::Field - can non-prime fields break cryptography? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Trait: Convert] [Pairing bound] Does the Convert trait implementation properly enforce that E::ScalarField matches the field used in InputSecret, or can type mismatches cause conversion errors? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Struct: InputSecret] [Orphan instance] Can external crates define conflicting trait implementations for InputSecret, causing ambiguity or allowing trait implementation injection attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Struct: InputSecret] [Drop trait] Does InputSecret implement Drop to securely zero memory on deallocation, or can secret values remain in memory after the struct is dropped? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Struct: InputSecret] [Stack allocation] When InputSecret is stack-allocated, can stack memory be recovered after function returns, allowing stack-scanning attacks to extract secrets? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Struct: InputSecret] [Memory alignment] Can misaligned memory access to InputSecret cause undefined behavior or enable timing attacks through alignment-dependent performance? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Struct: InputSecret] [Mem::forget abuse] Can mem::forget() be used to leak InputSecret without running the destructor, preventing secure memory zeroing? (High)
